section.title: Cross-site Data Replication (XDR) measurements
section.p: The NCC Aerospike database provides a cross-site data replication (XDR) feature to keep multiple copies of data in sync across a geographically diverse network. NCC software makes use of these metrics to help determine the health of peer NCC systems and whether the data replication is caught up or is experiencing issues and falling behind. When a given NCC is recovering from an OOS condition and is progressing toward becoming IS again, these XDR metrics are used to automatically determine whether the local data is caught back up to the network and therefore when it is appropriate to return to an IS state and start accepting traffic again.

These metrics are NOT stored in Prometheus, are NOT written to the 3GPPXML files and are therefore NOT made available for northbound OSS systems, such as Nokia NetAct. They are available to users via the db-stats and xdr-status tools to support troubleshooting on a given NCC system.
See for more information about the db-stats tool.
See for more information about the xdr-status tool.
